clinical_study.brief_title: Parent-delivered Massage for Children With Autism - Ages 6 to 11
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1 Study of the Parent-delivered Massage Treatment Protocol for Children With Autism Ages 6 to 11

brief_summary.textblock: Through funding from the U.S. Maternal and Child Health Bureau, Teaching Research Institute at Western Oregon University (WOU) will be conducting research on the effect of a parent-delivered massage program on measures of autism and general development in children ages 6 to 11 with autism. Families will participate in an initial training, and receive 24 sessions of ongoing support and training from a trained therapist over the first nine months.

detailed_description.textblock:
Children will be randomly divided into treatment groups and wait-list control groups. The control groups begin treatment five months after the treatment groups begin.
All children will be tested on three occasions in the first year: prior to beginning treatment, and five and twelve months later. Results will be shared with parents at the end of each year. Testers will remain blinded as to which group is currently receiving treatment.
There is no cost to parents for participation in this research study. Families meeting the eligibility criteria will be accepted into the study on a first-come, first-served basis.

primary_outcome.description: The Childhood Autism Rating Scales will be used to measure this.

secondary_outcome.description: The Vineland II will be used to measure this.

other_outcome.description: The Preschool Language Scale-5 will be used to measure this.

other_outcome.measure: Change in co-morbid symptoms of autism
other_outcome.description: The Sense and Self-Regulation Checklist will be used to measure this.

other_outcome.measure: Change in degree of parenting stress
other_outcome.description: The Autism Parenting Stress Index will be used to measure this.

arm_group.description: Children in this group receive the parent-delivered massage intervention right after randomization.
Children in this group receive the parent-delivered massage intervention 5 months after randomization.

intervention.description: The parent-delivered massage is based on Chinese medicine. There are specific techniques for each area of difficulty, e.g. the head, fingers, and toes. After a few months, massage becomes relaxing and enjoyable, and parent touch comes back into use to effectively help the child self-regulate.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have a medical and/or educational diagnosis of autism
- Be between the age of 6 and 11
- Parents willing to attend the parent training session and transport the child to treatment sessions with trained staff 20 times in the first five months
- Parents willing to give the fifteen-minute massage daily
- Parents willing not to start any new interventions unless medically necessary
Exclusion Criteria:
- Taking psychoactive medication or pharmaceutical chelation therapy
- Additional chronic disability (for example, cerebral palsy or uncontrolled seizures)
- Receiving more than fifteen hours per week of intensive behavioral treatment for autism (e.g. Applied Behavior Analysis therapy)
